population_specificity: Six breast cancer patients with long-standing lymphedema (duration 2-17 years) who had undergone breast surgery, axillary lymph node dissection, chemotherapy, and radiotherapy.
effective_dosage: 100% oxygen at two times atmospheric pressure for 90 minutes, five times a week for 30 sessions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to report a rare case of lupus podocytopathy (LP) in a patient with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) and type 1 diabetes mellitus (T1DM), and review its implications for prognosis and treatment.
results_summary: The study found that a 28-year-old woman with LP and T1DM achieved complete remission of nephrotic syndrome following immunosuppressive and antiproteinuric therapy. The case is noted as the first reported instance of LP in Peru.
population_specificity: A 28-year-old woman with a history of type 1 diabetes mellitus and systemic lupus erythematosus.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the usability, functional changes, and caregivers' perspectives of the Moonwalker exoskeleton in children with severe cerebral palsy (CP) to enhance mobility and quality of life.
results_summary: Post-treatment, most children showed improved endurance and gait speed (≥0.5 m/s), with enhanced upper trunk and arm movements. The exoskeleton was well-received by families and facilitated home training, social interaction, and endurance.
population_specificity: Children aged 2-8 years with severe gait impairment and inability to use conventional walkers due to cerebral palsy.
study_duration: 20 training sessions followed by five months of home use.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of using a standing desk on craniovertebral angle, muscle fatigue, work performance, and discomfort in individuals with forward head posture.
results_summary: The study found that using a standing desk significantly improved craniovertebral angle, reduced muscle fatigue (especially in the levator scapulae muscles), and decreased discomfort in the neck and shoulders compared to a traditional desk. Work performance was also assessed, though specific results were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Office workers with forward head posture (24 participants).

study_goal: The researchers reported a rare case of spontaneous transvaginal small bowel evisceration in an elderly woman with a history of uterine and rectal prolapse, focusing on surgical management and outcomes.
results_summary: The study described a failed vaginal reduction attempt due to edema, followed by successful surgical intervention via laparotomy, with deferred definitive surgery for prolapse due to the patient's condition. The patient recovered postoperatively but died from a myocardial infarction 3 months later.
population_specificity: A woman in her late 60s with a long history of uterine and rectal prolapse.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining supine and standing positions for varicocele imaging improves diagnostic accuracy compared to the traditional supine-only approach.
results_summary: The study found that using both supine and standing positions for varicocele imaging reduces misdiagnosis rates, particularly for right-sided or bilateral varicoceles, by making varicosity more prominent under increased lower abdominal pressure.
population_specificity: Males undergoing varicocele diagnostic angiography.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (positioning technique, not a supplement).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if using a height-adjustable desk to facilitate stepping while standing could maintain physical therapy benefits and reduce sedentary behavior in Parkinson's patients.
results_summary: Post-physical therapy, all participants improved in mobility and quality of life. The intervention group maintained these benefits and showed additional improvements in mobility, activity time, balance, and quality of life after 4 months of desk use, while the control group regressed.
population_specificity: Fourteen Parkinson's patients (71±4.08 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the acute neuromuscular effects of random practice (varying jump length) versus block practice (constant jump length) during repeated standing long jumps.
results_summary: Both random and constant jump conditions led to similar decreases in physical performance and neuromuscular fatigue (e.g., reduced MViC, CMJ, EMG, and T-reflex). However, random practice was more enjoyable and subjectively perceived as better performing by participants.
population_specificity: Fifteen healthy young participants.
effective_dosage: 100 repeated standing long jumps (20 minutes of fatiguing exercise).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare gaze patterns and support strategies of expert and novice physical therapists during assisted standing to identify differences in attention and biomechanical outcomes.
results_summary: Experts focused more on the head area, facilitated slower center of mass sway, and positioned collaborators with greater trunk flexion during standing transitions compared to novices. These findings suggest experts optimize movement efficiency by monitoring the head and center of mass.
population_specificity: Experienced physical therapists (experts) and physical therapy students (novices) assisting collaborators acting as patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a method for identifying Parkinson's disease (PD) and its stages using static standing balance data and machine learning.
results_summary: The study successfully classified six participant groups (control and five PD stages) with an F1-score of 0.963 using a Transformer encoder-based classifier trained on center of pressure trajectory data. This approach improves accessibility for PD assessment, enabling earlier detection and intervention.
population_specificity: 210 participants, including a control group and five PD groups categorized by disease stage.
study_duration: Participants completed a 10-second static standing balance task.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare clinical, functional, and immunological features between elderly asthmatics with long-standing asthma (LSA) and late-onset asthma (LOA).
results_summary: The study found significant differences between LSA and LOA groups, including more severe airway obstruction and higher frequency of positive skin prick tests in LSA, but no differences in sputum cell counts or inflammatory profiles. Both groups showed high frequencies of cognitive impairment, poor inhaler technique, and low adherence to treatment, despite good disease control.
population_specificity: Elderly asthmatics older than 64 years, divided into long-standing asthma (onset before age 40) and late-onset asthma (onset from age 40 onward).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight a rare complication of diabetes mellitus, diabetic myonecrosis (DMN), to facilitate earlier detection and treatment.
results_summary: The study found that diabetic myonecrosis, though rare, should be considered in diabetic patients presenting with acute limb pain and swelling, with MRI being a sensitive diagnostic tool. Supportive care focused on pain management remains the standard treatment.
population_specificity: A 49-year-old man with type 2 diabetes mellitus.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate changes in sedentary time during an activity modification strategy for sports-active adolescents with patellofemoral pain (PFP) and Osgood-Schlatter (OSD).
results_summary: The study found non-significant increases in sedentary time (14min/day for PFP, 9min/day and 0min/day for OSD) during and after activity modification, with variability among individuals.
population_specificity: Sports-active adolescents with PFP (n=138) or OSD (n=47).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a green chemistry method for preparing gold nanoparticle-graphene oxide (Au@GO) nanocomposites and assess their catalytic efficacy in degrading commercial dyes.
results_summary: The study found that the Au@GO nanocomposite rapidly catalyzed the degradation of methyl orange and methylene blue using hydrogen peroxide generated in situ, with minimal waste production, suggesting potential for wastewater treatment applications.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop high-performance, cost-efficient electrocatalysts and electrodes for improving the hydrogen evolution reaction (HER) in microbial electrolysis cells (MECs).
results_summary: The study found that cobalt phosphide-supported carbon nanofiber (CNF) films exhibited high surface area, nanoporosity, and excellent HER activity in alkaline media, enabling efficient hydrogen production with low energy consumption (below 30 kWh kg-1 H2). The films also demonstrated high electrical conductivity and mechanical stability, making them suitable for direct use as cathodes in MEC reactors.
population_specificity: Not applicable (materials science study, no human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of cryoballoon ablation (CBA) for long-standing persistent atrial fibrillation (PeAF) compared to PeAF.
results_summary: The study found similar recurrence rates of atrial tachyarrhythmias (ATs) between PeAF and long-standing PeAF patients (41.4% vs. 40.1%). Larger left atrium size and longer AF duration were associated with higher recurrence rates.
population_specificity: 1484 patients with non-paroxysmal AF (367 PeAF and 1117 long-standing PeAF) from the Korean CBA registry.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the structural, chemical, and thermoelectric properties of 3D-printed free-standing GZO films with substrate-constrained GZO films to evaluate their potential for wearable thermoelectric applications.
results_summary: The free-standing GZO film showed a 14% increase in electrical conductivity and a 91% improvement in the Seebeck coefficient compared to the substrate-constrained film, resulting in a higher room-temperature power factor of 261 nW/m·K2. The study highlighted the advantages of 3D-printed free-standing films in eliminating substrate-induced stresses and improving performance.
population_specificity: Not applicable (material science study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of mitral valve repair combined with the maze procedure versus catheter ablation in patients with severe atrial functional mitral regurgitation due to long-standing persistent atrial fibrillation.
results_summary: The surgical group had lower rates of atrial fibrillation recurrence and heart failure readmission, as well as reduced mitral regurgitation severity at discharge and follow-up, but no significant differences in 5-year survival or long-term outcomes were observed between the two groups.
population_specificity: Patients with severe atrial functional mitral regurgitation and long-standing persistent atrial fibrillation.
study_duration: Follow-up period between 2018 and 2022 (exact intervention duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to present a case study of a patient with long-standing cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (cSCC) in a challenging facial location, highlighting the therapeutic and aesthetic challenges of surgical resection and reconstruction.
results_summary: The study described a case of cSCC in a difficult-to-access facial area, emphasizing the challenges of surgical treatment and reconstruction while achieving an aesthetically pleasing outcome. No specific results regarding Standing were mentioned.
population_specificity: A single patient with long-standing cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (cSCC) in a difficult-to-access facial area.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether questioning gender stereotype threat (ST) could mitigate the decline in girls' standing long jump (SLJ) performance caused by gender ST.
results_summary: The study found that gender ST induction decreased girls' SLJ performance, but this negative effect was reduced when the ST was accompanied by a questioning condition, preventing the decline in performance.
population_specificity: 120 girls (mean age = 10.74 ± 0.85 years)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of impaired ANP secretion in heart failure with preserved ejection fraction due to long-standing AF and the potential of sacubitril/valsartan to improve symptoms by increasing endogenous ANP levels.
results_summary: The study found that sacubitril/valsartan improved symptoms (dyspnea and edema) and increased ANP levels from 46.1 pg/mL to 117 pg/mL, while reducing NT-proBNP levels, suggesting efficacy in treating heart failure with impaired ANP secretion.
population_specificity: A patient with heart failure with preserved ejection fraction and long-standing atrial fibrillation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare spinal flexibility assessment and radiation exposure between fulcrum bending radiographs (FBRs) and standing side-bending radiographs (SSRs) in adolescent idiopathic scoliosis (AIS) patients.
results_summary: FBRs were superior to SSRs for assessing flexibility in thoracic curves and predicting post-surgery correction, but SSRs resulted in significantly lower radiation exposure. No significant difference was found for lumbar curves between the two methods.
population_specificity: 25 consecutive AIS patients aged 12-18 years scheduled for surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the preliminary efficacy of structured positive feedback (PF) for improving standing reach ability in older adults and evaluate the feasibility of a future full-scale RCT.
results_summary: The study found that structured PF showed potential efficacy for improving standing reach ability (moderate effect size), but it also increased fear of falling in the experimental group, while having negligible effects on functional independence.
population_specificity: Older adults (mean age 83.3 years, 23 women) admitted to a convalescent rehabilitation ward.
effective_dosage: PF intervention for standing reach ability once every 3 days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the progress of dissolving microneedles (MNs) in anti-melanoma treatment, focusing on their role in improving conventional therapies and enabling synergistic combinations with novel therapies.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that dissolving MNs improve drug delivery efficiency, reduce side effects, and enhance therapeutic efficacy in melanoma treatment, particularly when combined with novel therapies like photothermal, photodynamic, and chemodynamic therapies.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare lower extremity muscle activity during squats in standing, kneeling, and half-kneeling positions to determine their effects on muscle activation.
results_summary: The study found that muscle activity in the rectus femoris, gluteus medius, and biceps femoris was highest in the half-kneeling position, followed by standing and kneeling. The standing position showed significant differences in muscle activity between ascent and descent phases for all measured muscles.
population_specificity: 30 healthy adults (19 males, 11 females).
study_duration: Single session with squats performed for 9 seconds per repetition (4s descent, 1s maintenance, 4s ascent).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of tildrakizumab, an IL-23 antagonist, in treating severe refractory pityriasis rubra pilaris (PRP) and its impact on quality of life and long-term remission.
results_summary: The study found that tildrakizumab significantly improved PRP symptoms, including erythema, scaling, and lesion thickness, leading to enhanced quality of life. The patient remained relapse-free during a three-year follow-up after treatment cessation.
population_specificity: A 43-year-old female with severe refractory PRP and a history of breast cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining functional electrical stimulation (FES) with visual feedback balance training (VFBT) could improve standing balance control in individuals with incomplete spinal cord injury (iSCI).
results_summary: The study found that the designed FES+VFBT controller generated physiologically relevant electrical stimulations, as evidenced by high correlations between controller outputs and recorded muscle activity (EMG) in most tasks. The results suggest potential for improving standing balance in iSCI patients.
population_specificity: Ten young able-bodied individuals (not iSCI patients).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to describe an unusual case of a long-standing neurofibroma in the hand and discuss its clinical presentation, diagnosis, and treatment.
results_summary: The study reported a case of a 70-year-old patient with a neurofibroma in the hand, which was surgically excised under local anesthesia. Histopathology confirmed the diagnosis, and follow-up showed persistent tingling but no major complications.
population_specificity: A 70-year-old right-handed individual with hypertension and a pacemaker.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to describe the presentation, diagnosis, and treatment of a rare retroperitoneal schwannoma in a patient.
results_summary: The study found that retroperitoneal schwannomas are rare and often asymptomatic, making preoperative diagnosis challenging. Complete surgical excision was successful in this case, with no recurrence reported.
population_specificity: A 36-year-old female with a retroperitoneal schwannoma.

study_goal: To determine the effects of postural and kinesthetic awareness on plantar pressure and static standing stability in chronic stroke patients.
results_summary: The experimental group (B) showed significantly better outcomes in balance and plantar pressure compared to the control group (A), with statistical significance (p<0.05). Postural and kinesthetic awareness was suggested as a beneficial rehabilitative strategy for enhancing balance in chronic stroke patients.
population_specificity: Chronic stroke patients aged 45-60 years with visual spatial neglect.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the clinical presentation, diagnostic process, and management of Platypnea-orthodeoxia syndrome (POS) in an elderly patient with unexplained dyspnea.
results_summary: The study identified a patent foramen ovale as the cause of POS in an 85-year-old female, confirmed via transesophageal echocardiogram. The case highlights the importance of thorough diagnostic evaluation for unexplained dyspnea, particularly in high-risk patients.
population_specificity: 85-year-old female with a history of multiple falls, cerebrovascular disease, and recent femur fracture.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of a standing platform for efficient clinical trials in oncology, focusing on early molecular evidence of disease (MED) via circulating tumor DNA to predict recurrence and test treatments.
results_summary: The study found that MED strongly predicts cancer recurrence, with most patients showing radiographic evidence within 18 months, enabling smaller and faster trials compared to conventional adjuvant trials. Circulating tumor DNA could also serve as an early biomarker for treatment effects.
population_specificity: Patients with early-stage cancer who have undergone curative-intent therapy and show early molecular evidence of disease (MED) via circulating tumor DNA.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of rilonacept in managing chronic recurrent pericarditis in a patient who could not taper off anakinra.
results_summary: The patient experienced symptom abatement and improvement in inflammatory changes on cardiac MRI after transitioning to rilonacept therapy. The positive response suggests rilonacept may be effective for chronic recurrent pericarditis in this context.
population_specificity: A 65-year-old woman with a history of idiopathic pericarditis and chronic recurrent pericarditis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of rhythm control (using electrical cardioversion) versus rate control (using atrioventricular node ablation) strategies in maintaining high biventricular pacing percentage (BiVp%) in CRT recipients with long-standing persistent atrial fibrillation.
results_summary: Both rhythm and rate control strategies similarly increased BiVp% to near-maximal levels (99% vs. 98%), but only the rhythm control group showed significant improvement in left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF), particularly in patients who maintained sinus rhythm. No differences were observed in maximal oxygen uptake, quality of life, or clinical and safety endpoints.
population_specificity: CRT recipients with long-standing persistent atrial fibrillation and low BiVp% (mean age 68.4 years, mean AF duration 25 months).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop lignin-derived functional materials, specifically aerogels, for energy storage applications by tailoring lignin's thermal properties through fractionation and heat treatment.
results_summary: The study successfully created flexible lignin aerogels with significant shape recovery properties and tailored physical characteristics, such as resilience and compressive strength, which showed potential as free-standing electrodes with capacitance values surpassing some graphene-based supercapacitors.
population_specificity: Not applicable (material science study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a safer and more practical method for synthesizing cubic gauche nitrogen (cg-N) as a high-energy-density material (HEDM).
results_summary: The study successfully synthesized free-standing cg-N using potassium azide and plasma-enhanced chemical vapor deposition, demonstrating excellent thermal stability up to 760 K and rapid decomposition typical of HEDMs. Explosion parameters were measured using laser-induced plasma spectroscopy.
population_specificity: Not applicable (material science study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether adding midazolam to a standard equine standing sedation protocol improved sedation quality during routine oral examinations.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in sedation scores between midazolam and placebo groups, though minor trends suggested improved sedation characteristics (e.g., reduced tongue movement and better speculum acceptance) with midazolam. No undesired side effects were observed.
population_specificity: Twelve horses undergoing routine oral examinations.
effective_dosage: Midazolam (0.02mg/kg IV), detomidine (0.01mg/kg IV), and butorphanol (0.01mg/kg IV), with optional additional sedation (detomidine 0.006mg/kg IV and butorphanol 0.006mg/kg IV).
study_duration: Two examinations spaced at least seven days apart.

study_goal: To investigate the effect of computer-based early intervention with a playpen on standing and walking, and its relationship with gross motor percentile and segmental trunk control in preterm infants.
results_summary: The intervention significantly improved gross motor percentiles and segmental trunk control in preterm infants, with strong correlations between motor development and reactive trunk control during walking.
population_specificity: Preterm infants born before 37 weeks of gestation.
effective_dosage: 45 minutes of play in standing and walking positions, five times a week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the association between physical activity (including endurance exercise) and coronary artery disease (CAD), focusing on clinical and prognostic implications in athletes.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that high-volume, long-term endurance exercise may accelerate coronary atherosclerosis progression, with some studies showing increased coronary calcified plaque and potential adverse cardiovascular events in elite athletes. However, the exact mechanisms remain unclear.
population_specificity: Endurance athletes, particularly those over 35 years old.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of harm reduction as a treatment approach for patients with Severe and Enduring Anorexia Nervosa, considering its potential benefits and risks.
results_summary: The abstract highlights uncertainty about whether to refine current treatments or explore alternatives like harm reduction, which emphasizes autonomy and quality of life but may pose risks if considered the endpoint of treatment. The review also discusses ethical and contextual issues in eating disorder treatment.
population_specificity: Patients with Severe and Enduring Anorexia Nervosa.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a custom-made polydioxanone stent in treating a urethral stricture in a horse with sabulous cystitis.
results_summary: The stent successfully resolved dysuria and allowed normal bladder emptying, with the urethra remaining patent after stent reabsorption. The horse maintained athletic performance without recurrence of symptoms 19 months post-procedure.
population_specificity: A 10-year-old Irish Sport Horse gelding with complications from general anesthesia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how plant traits evolve in response to changes in mating systems (outcrossing, mixed mating, and selfing) in Mimulus guttatus populations.
results_summary: After 10 generations, traits like flower size, phenology, and reproductive capacity diverged among mating system treatments, with selfing populations showing reduced stigma-anther separation, smaller flowers, and lower per-flower reproductive capacity. Mixed mating populations exhibited intermediate trait values between selfing and outcrossing populations.
population_specificity: Genetically diverse and outcrossing natural populations of Mimulus guttatus (a flowering plant).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of exercise in standing versus lying positions on quality of life and clinical symptoms in women with mild varicose veins.
results_summary: Both standing and lying exercise groups showed significant improvements in quality of life, pain reduction, and decreased ankle swelling and circumferences compared to the control group, with no significant difference between the two exercise groups.
population_specificity: Women aged 35-50 years with mild varicose veins.
effective_dosage: Not specified (exercise program details not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to describe the clinical and neuropathological characteristics of progressive supranuclear palsy (PSP) with preserved levodopa response, focusing on a case study.
results_summary: The study found that a patient with dopa-responsive Parkinsonism and MIBG abnormalities had PSP pathology at autopsy, suggesting clinical and pathological heterogeneity in PSP. Genetic factors may have played a protective role in the patient's protracted course.
population_specificity: A 73-year-old Japanese man with a 13-year history of dopa-responsive Parkinsonism.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of lymphopenia at various time points (before, during, and after radiotherapy) on survival outcomes in rectal cancer patients.
results_summary: The study found that sustained lymphopenia following radiotherapy was associated with poorer survival outcomes, with 52% of patients with lymphopenia alive without disease compared to 89.7% with normal lymphocyte levels. Pre-existing lymphopenia before radiotherapy was linked to a three times greater chance of death.
population_specificity: 110 patients treated for rectal cancer between 2015 and 2019.
study_duration: Follow-up time points up to 2 years after radiotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate how responsibility attributions and kinship influence witnesses' willingness to intervene in moral violations of varying severity.
results_summary: The study found that people are more willing to help perceived innocent victims in less-severe situations, but in more-severe situations, willingness to intervene increases regardless of responsibility. Kinship did not show significant effects, and partial evidence suggested higher cost acceptance for intervention in severe situations.
population_specificity: Not specified (general population implied)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility and effectiveness of standing laparoscopic ligation of testicular arteries as an emergency treatment for uncontrolled post-castration hemorrhage in young geldings.
results_summary: Standing laparoscopic ligation successfully halted hemorrhage in both cases, with procedure times of 25 and 35 minutes, and no complications reported. The approach allowed coagulation of both left and right spermatic vessels in one case.
population_specificity: Two young geldings (6 and 9 months old) with severe post-castration hemorrhage.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the prevalence of orthostatic intolerance (OI) in children with long COVID using a bedside passive standing test.
results_summary: The study found that 71% of children with long COVID met criteria for an orthostatic condition, including POTS, OT, OH, delayed OH, and orthostatic hypertension, indicating OI is common in this population.
population_specificity: 92 children with long COVID attending a pediatric post-COVID-19 rehabilitation clinic.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight a rare case of rapid progression from solitary rectal ulcer syndrome (SRUS) to mucinous adenocarcinoma, emphasizing the need for clinical vigilance.
results_summary: The study found that a 29-year-old male with SRUS rapidly developed mucinous adenocarcinoma despite treatment, which was effectively managed with surgical resection and adjuvant chemotherapy. The case underscores the importance of early detection and intervention in SRUS-associated malignancies.
population_specificity: A 29-year-old male patient with SRUS.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the use of metagenomic next-generation sequencing (mNGS) for early prediction and exclusion of neonatal varicella infection in a preterm infant at risk.
results_summary: The study found that mNGS effectively ruled out varicella zoster virus (VZV) infection in a preterm infant, with no subsequent symptoms observed during follow-up, demonstrating its potential for early detection and reassurance in neonatal care.
population_specificity: Preterm infant born to a mother with varicella.
study_duration: 14-day hospital stay followed by 7 days at home.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the feasibility and acceptability of a remote-delivered brief cognitive task intervention for reducing intrusive memories in women with long-standing trauma.
results_summary: Participants reported a 68% reduction in intrusive memories by Week 5 and a 91% reduction at 3-month follow-up, alongside improvements in other psychological symptoms and functioning. The intervention was deemed feasible and acceptable based on participant feedback.
population_specificity: Women in Iceland who had experienced trauma on average two decades earlier (n = 12).
study_duration: Baseline monitoring for one week, followed by at least two remote intervention sessions and self-guided continuation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify key contributors, assess global scientific production, and predict future development patterns in PSMA-targeted radiotheranostics research.
results_summary: The study analyzed 694 original studies over 30 years, mapping publication trends, leading countries, cocitations, and coauthorship networks to reveal evolutionary patterns and key players in the PSMA field.
population_specificity: Not specified (bibliometric analysis of research literature)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the outcomes of standing transcorneal aspiration of primary iris cysts (STAPIC) in horses as an alternative treatment method.
results_summary: STAPIC was found to be effective, with no recurrence in treated eyes during follow-up (median 6 months), though one horse developed a cyst in the contralateral eye after 3 years. Adverse effects were rare (two cases of uveitis/fibrin) and resolved with treatment, with 61% of owners reporting no further clinical signs.
population_specificity: Horses with primary iris cysts (18 cases across four centers).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the associations between standing (as part of sedentary behavior and physical activity) and hepatic glucose uptake (HGU) and endogenous glucose production (EGP) in adults with metabolic syndrome.
results_summary: The study found that standing was associated with lower endogenous glucose production (EGP), suggesting a beneficial effect on hepatic insulin sensitivity. However, no direct associations were found between standing and hepatic glucose uptake (HGU).
population_specificity: Adults with metabolic syndrome (mean age 58 years, BMI 25-40 kg/m², 25 females).
study_duration: Accelerometer measurements were taken over 26 (SD 3) days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the dominance of attentional focus (internal vs. external) in standing postural control between healthy younger and older adults to understand the aging process.
results_summary: The study found that both younger and older adults could be divided into internal focus-dominant and external focus-dominant groups, confirming attentional focus dominance. Older adults' performance under external focus conditions was influenced by this dominance.
population_specificity: Healthy younger and older adults.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the combined effect of ready-to-use supplementary food (RUSF) and high-intensity motor learning (HiML) on motor skill-related physical fitness in children with moderate thinness.
results_summary: The study found that a 12-week combination of RUSF + HiML significantly improved motor skill-related physical fitness, with comparable gains in stepping, side jump, standing long jump, and jumping and hopping, except for ball skills where the HiML group performed better.
population_specificity: Children aged 5-7 years with moderate thinness in Jimma Town.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to reconcile contradictory findings on vitamin D's role in cancer prevention by reviewing literature and assessing study limitations.
results_summary: The study found that while biological mechanisms suggest a link between low vitamin D and increased cancer risk, clinical trials with cholecalciferol supplementation have not demonstrated clear preventive benefits. High interindividual variability in response to supplementation was noted.
population_specificity: General population with a focus on cancer risk and vitamin D status.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate and compare the efficacy of different growth hormone (GH) supplementation protocols in improving outcomes for poor ovarian response (POR) patients undergoing assisted reproductive therapy.
results_summary: Daily administration of 4-8 IU of GH during the follicular phase showed the best comprehensive therapeutic effects, improving oocyte retrieval, mature oocytes, endometrial thickness, and reducing gonadotropin requirements. Subgroup analysis indicated significant improvements in clinical pregnancy rates for RCT and African subgroups.
population_specificity: Poor ovarian response (POR) patients undergoing assisted reproductive therapy.
effective_dosage: 4-8 IU daily during the follicular phase.
study_duration: Brief treatment duration (specific length not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers were examining the role of reductive stress, rather than oxidative stress, in male infertility and its damaging mechanisms.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that reductive stress, caused by over-accumulation of reductants, may contribute to male infertility through mechanisms like guanidine oxidation and DNA fragmentation. It identifies potential sources of excessive reductant accumulation, such as dietary supplementation, NADPH overproduction, and elevated GSH levels.
population_specificity: Not specified (abstract focuses on mechanisms rather than a specific study population).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare clinical practice and prognosis in elderly patients with ulcerative colitis (UC) between those with elderly-onset UC (EOUC) and those with long-standing elderly UC (LEUC).
results_summary: The study found that patients with EOUC had higher cumulative rates of initiating systemic steroids and molecular targeted drugs (MTDs) compared to LEUC patients, suggesting rapid progression and refractoriness in EOUC. Cumulative colectomy rates did not differ significantly between the two groups.
population_specificity: Elderly patients with UC aged ≥ 60 years, divided into EOUC (onset ≥ 60 years) and LEUC (onset < 60 years).
study_duration: Data collected from diagnosis until August 2022 (retrospective study, duration not explicitly stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if transcutaneous oxygenation in the lower limb, measured by hyperspectral imaging (HSI), changes with the clinical component of the CEAP classification in chronic venous disorders (CVD) when comparing supine and standing positions.
results_summary: The study found that deoxyhemoglobin levels increased significantly in the standing position compared to supine, particularly in the gaiter region, and this increase was more pronounced with higher CEAP clinical classes. These changes were not observed in supine measurements.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic venous disorders (CVD) recruited from a vascular specialist clinic at a tertiary hospital (median age 59 years, 63% women).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (standing position was the intervention, not a dosage).
study_duration: Participants stood for 15 minutes before measurements.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore key considerations for training community health workers (CHWs) in response to their evolving roles and provide actionable recommendations for health systems leaders.
results_summary: The study identified three key themes: professionalism, quality and performance, and scaling up, emphasizing the need for ongoing, professionalized training integrated with other health cadres to enhance CHW programmes.
population_specificity: Community health workers (CHWs) and health systems stakeholders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether sodium citrate (CIT) supplementation, by stimulating plasma volume expansion, would improve heart rate variability (HRV) recovery after dehydrating exercise in endurance-trained men.
results_summary: CIT supplementation led to greater plasma volume expansion compared to placebo but did not improve HRV recovery or influence HRV responsiveness in any tested condition (supine or standing). HRV parameters worsened similarly in both trials post-exercise.
population_specificity: Endurance-trained men
effective_dosage: Not specified (supplemented with CIT or placebo in prescribed food)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether vitamin D supplementation combined with a multimodal exercise program improves postural balance and muscle strength in older women with low bone mineral density and vitamin D insufficiency.
results_summary: Vitamin D levels increased in the experimental group, but the combination of vitamin D and exercise did not significantly enhance muscle strength or postural balance compared to the control group. Both groups showed improvements in some muscle strength and balance measures, but no additional benefit was observed from vitamin D supplementation.
population_specificity: Older women with low bone mineral density and vitamin D insufficiency who were not practicing resistance exercise.

study_goal: To develop a consensus statement for prescribing Powered Wheelchair Standing Devices (PWSD) in young people with Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD).
results_summary: Consensus was reached on 47 of 80 items, identifying tolerance and comfort in standing for at least 10 minutes, ankle contracture under 10 degrees, and user motivation as key factors for PWSD trials. Family, therapist, and servicing support were deemed critical for sustained use.
population_specificity: Young people with Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent developments in hydrogel-based technologies for type 1 diabetes management, focusing on insulin delivery and cell replacement therapies.
results_summary: The study summarized advancements in glucose-sensitive and pH-sensitive hydrogels for insulin delivery, as well as hydrogel encapsulation of insulin-secreting cells to improve biocompatibility and functionality. It highlighted the potential of hydrogels to address key challenges in diabetes therapies but noted the need for further interdisciplinary research.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether progesterone supplementation in early pregnancy could prevent miscarriage, focusing on micronized natural progesterone and synthetic progestogens.
results_summary: The study found that vaginal micronized progesterone may benefit women with a history of miscarriage who experience bleeding in early pregnancy, based on the totality of evidence.
population_specificity: Women with a past history of miscarriage presenting with bleeding in early pregnancy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the applications of noninvasive neurostimulation techniques (TMS and transcranial direct current stimulation) in the diagnosis and management of epilepsy.
results_summary: The study found that both TMS and transcranial direct current stimulation may reduce seizure frequency in medically refractory epilepsy patients with minimal side effects. Additionally, TMS combined with EEG could help develop biomarkers for cortical hyperexcitability, and navigated TMS shows promise for preoperative functional planning.
population_specificity: Patients with medically refractory epilepsy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if higher doses of vitamin D3 supplementation reduced the risk of orthostatic hypotension (OH) in older adults.
results_summary: The study found that higher doses of vitamin D3 (1,000+ IU/day) were not associated with changes in seated, standing, or orthostatic blood pressure and did not lower the risk of OH or orthostatic symptoms compared to a lower dose (200 IU/day).
population_specificity: Adults aged 70 years and older with low serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D (10-29 ng/ml).
effective_dosage: 200 IU/day (comparison) vs. 1,000, 2,000, and 4,000 IU/day (combined as 1,000+ IU/day).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize and quantify physical and functional losses due to aging and diseases, focusing on how lower limb exoskeletons could mitigate these losses.
results_summary: The study found significant declines in muscle force, power, oxygen consumption, walking speed, and balance, along with increased fall-related injuries and deaths, particularly in older adults and those with mobility impairments. Exoskeletons were proposed as a potential solution to compensate for these losses.
population_specificity: Older adults (25-90 yrs) and individuals with mobility impairments due to cardiovascular, respiratory, musculoskeletal, or neurological diseases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether vitamin D supplementation affects physical performance measures in vitamin D-deficient, mildly trained children.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide results regarding the effects of vitamin D supplementation on physical performance.
population_specificity: Thirty-six recreationally soccer player boys with vitamin D deficiency.
effective_dosage: Single dose of 200,000 IU of VD3.
